F. & G. Witherby |location= London |year= 1977 |isbn= 0-85493-123-6}} * {{citation |last= Tully |first= Clive |title= The Visitor's Guide to East Anglia |publisher= Moorland |location= Ashbourne, UK |year= Independent article] — dead *[http://www.wildlifetrusts.org/index.php?section=news&id=1761 Carbon-neutral hearing system] *[http://www.lsiarchitects.co.uk/project.php?p=82122&img=1 Architects for new visitor's centre] '''updated link''' *[http://www.bbccountryfile.com/walkinfo.asp?ID=167 BBC countryfile walk] — dead *[http://www.countrymanmagazine.co.uk/diary_july2007.html Countryman Magazine brief] *[http://www.northnorfolk.org/environment/215_1536.asp Graham Allen award commendation] '''updated link''' *[http://www.wnibi.com/Building/Articles.aspx/18205 More potential building awards] *[http://books.google.com/books?id=4uCGSfPEB2oC&pg=RA2-PA364&lpg=RA2-PA364&dq=%22cley+marshes%22&source=web&ots=HJMe1HYIGZ&sig=BA3tjsl_bAPsc00WPpebYAKYNVQ&hl=en&sa=X&oi=book_result&resnum=7&ct=result#PRA2-PA363,M1 Geodiversity] *[http://www.norfolkwildlifetrust.org.uk/news/cley_marshes_visitor_centre_wins_labc_best_sustainability_innovation_award Award] — dead *[http://www.norfolkwildlifetrust.org.uk/news/grand_opening_of_nwt_cley_marshes_visitor_centre Grand opening info] — dead More vis. centre info] — dead *[http://www.buildingtalk.com/news/ico/ico119.html Roof] — dead *[http://www.edp24.co.uk/home/search_7_1138?sort=publisheddate_descending&siteId=2.203&slotSearch=true&action=search&freeTextQuery=%22cley%20marshes%22&submitted=true list of articles related to Cley Marshes] '''new link''' ==To do== I guess for the moment that we just need to get the content in, copyediting and adding images can come later. *We need a map of the reserve. I'm not brilliant at this, but I'll do it unless you are particularly keen. I'd suggest that we keep the same colour scheme as [[Titchwell Marsh]] for consistency. *Part of the history is still unreferenced, do you have the source? ::I've expanded the history, only the 1921 north bank is still unsourced *I may have a source for the very early days of Cley as a port before land reclamation silted up the river, I think it's pre-C14. Is that relevant enough to put in? ::The old port was actually where the Glaven ran between Cley and Wiveton, not in front of the A149, so peripheral I think. [[User:Jimfbleak|Jimfbleak]] - [[User talk:Jimfbleak| talk to me?]] 15:56, 29 June 2012 (UTC) :::Added anyway, since related to reclamation * I'm unsure how far to push the economic benefits. For Titchwell, it was straightforward, a tiny village with two 3-star hotels and an optics shop. Cley is a bit bigger, but just the George and some B&Bs. It has shops that you might not expect in a small town (smokery, deli, gallery) but I'm not sure how closely we can tie these to the reserve â€” although it does get 100,000 visitors pa ::Found another source, expanded a bit [[User:Jimfbleak|Jimfbleak]] - [[User talk:Jimfbleak| talk to me?]] 15:56, 29 June 2012 (UTC) *It would be nice if we could get more military stuff. In the Titchwell article, that brought [[User:Dank|Dank]] on board, he's a very good copy editor. *Probably otherwise a bit premature to identify detailed content we still need to find. I'll look for evidence of wintering sea ducks on the sea, and see what I can find for animals and plants (RS for [[Broad-thighed Beetle]] for instance) ::Struggling with animals, but OK on plants, although I had to write stubs for two of them [[User:Jimfbleak|Jimfbleak]] - [[User talk:Jimfbleak| talk to me?]] 15:56, 29 June 2012 (UTC) [[User:Jimfbleak|Jimfbleak]] - [[User talk:Jimfbleak| talk to me?]] 06:52, 27 June 2012 (UTC) We have plenty of choice for an image for the bird section. For Titchwell, the Avocet was a no-brainer, since it's the RSPB's logo. The NWT logo is a [[Common Tern]], which visits, but does not breed on the reserve. Should we go for that, or pick a breeding species. Bittern? Marsh Harrier? [[User:Jimfbleak|Jimfbleak]] - [[User talk:Jimfbleak| talk to me?]] 09:38, 30 June 2012 (UTC) :I'd say go for a breeding species. Bittern or Marsh Harrier would be good choices. Or Bearded Tit. [[User:MeegsC|MeegsC]] | [[User talk:MeegsC|Talk]] 12:32, 30 June 2012 (UTC) == TFAR == [[Wikipedia:Today's featured article/requests/Cley Marshes]] --[[User:Gerda Arendt|Gerda Arendt]] ([[User talk:Gerda Arendt|talk]]) 21:31, 5 July 2015 (UTC) == Sources for requested updates re: flooding == *[https://www.gov.uk/government/news/east-coast-tidal-surge-1-year-on Government website] *[http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-norfolk-26239599 BBC video] *[http://norfolkwildlifetrust.org.uk/news/all-news/2014-01-06-flood-latest Norfolk Wildlife Trust piece] *[http://britishbirds.co.uk/article/natural-evolution-the-tidal-surge-in-north-norfolk/ British Birds piece] *[http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-25298428 Another BBC article] *[http://www.marinet.org.uk/impact-of-the-north-sea-surge-on-the-east-anglian-coast.html Marinet site] *[http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0012825215000628 Science Direct: Earth-Science reviews] *[http://norfolkwildlifeservices.co.uk/dev/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/job_227_NWSWinter2015_Online.pdf NWT newsletter] *[http://www.mccip.org.uk/media/1471/coastalhabitats2100report.pdf Environment Agency report] Also: *[http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2014/01/07/air-force-helicopter-crash-england/4361627/ Helicopter crash in reserve - 4 dead] Note for self and other editors for updating article... [[User:MeegsC|MeegsC]] ([[User talk:MeegsC|talk]]) 02:11, 6 July 2015 (UTC)
